bill_title: Honoring the 2002 Plankinton/White Lake Warriors High School football team, coaches, and staff.

bill_versions.bill_text: A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Honoring the 2002 Plankinton/White Lake Warriors High School football team, coaches, and staff. WHEREAS, the 2002 Plankinton/White Lake Warriors high school football team won the 9AA State High School Football Championship with an undefeated record of 12-0, outscoring their opponents 516-141 and rushing for 3,380 yards to the opponents' 1,490 yards during the season, through hard work, outstanding character, dedication, and perseverance; and WHEREAS, head coach Todd Karst and assistant coaches Jason Kolouseck, Scott Giblin, and Lawron Bohr provided excellent leadership and support to the members of the team, achieving the second ever state football championship in Plankinton and White Lake high schools' histories; and WHEREAS, the students of the 2002 Warriors football team showed enormous pride, unity, and great leadership on and off the field, and the six members of the Warriors team were named to the All-State football teams and one Honorable Mention: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Seventy-eighth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that the 2002 Plankinton/White Lake high school football team, coaches, and staff be recognized for their excellence in athletics for the 2002-2003 school year.

A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Honoring the 2002 Plankinton/White Lake Warriors High School football team, coaches, and staff. WHEREAS, the 2002 Plankinton/White Lake Warriors high school football team won the 9AA State High School Football Championship with an undefeated record of 12-0, outscoring their opponents 516-141 and rushing for 3,380 yards to the opponents' 1,490 yards during the season, through hard work, outstanding character, dedication, and perseverance; and WHEREAS, head coach Todd Karst and assistant coaches Jason Kolouseck, Scott Giblin, and Lawron Bohr provided excellent leadership and support to the members of the team, achieving the second ever state football championship in Plankinton and White Lake high schools' histories; and WHEREAS, the students of the 2002 Warriors football team showed enormous pride, unity, and great leadership on and off the field, and the six members of the Warriors team were named to the All-State football teams and one Honorable Mention: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Seventy-eighth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that the 2002 Plankinton/White Lake high school football team, coaches, and staff be recognized for their excellence in athletics for the 2002-2003 school year.
